page.title: 05FARMING S.E. OF WIRKSWORTH
page.content: MOST OF THE FARMS IN THE AREA ARE QUITE SMALL, UNDER 50 ACRES, ALTHOUGH THERE ARE TWO LARGER FARMS TOWARD ALDERWASLEY THAT CONCENTRATE ON CROP PRODUCTION, BARLEY, OIL SEED RAPE AND WHEAT. THE REMAINDER OF THE FARMS ARE MIXED; HAVING ANIMALS, BEEF CATTLE, MILKING HERDS, GOATS, CHICKENS, GEESE, DUCKS AND SHEEP; FIELDS THAT ARE MAINLY SET ASIDE AS ROUGH PASTURE OR GRASSLAND FOR THE HAY CROP WITH SOME OF THE LAND USED FOR POTATOES, GREEN VEGETABLES AND CORN. SOME OF THE HILLSIDES ARE STEEP AND HAVE BECOME WOODED AND COVERED WITH GORSE. THE NARROW ROADS AND TRACKS ARE KEPT CLEAN AND ALTHOUGH THE FARM YARDS ARE IN CONSTANT USE THEY TOO ARE WELL KEPT AND MAINTAINED. ONLY A FEW LOCAL PEOPLE WHO DO NOT LIVE ON THE FARMS AND SMALLHOLDINGS WORK ON THE LAND. FAMILY CONCERNS.
